page.title: 01PRESTATYN'S CHANGING TIMES
page.content: There have been settlers in Prestatyn since{Stone Age}times.Tools from the Stone &{Bronze Ages }have been found in this area. A{Roman}dig in Prestatyn during the last two years has revealed the remains of a{Roman {camp},a{fort}and a{small port.}The original{Domesday Book}records{ {Prestatyn}as{Presetone}which apparently derives from the Anglo-Saxon{Preosta Tun},i.e. a settlement in which two priests resided. On the outskirts of Prestatyn,just east of Bodnant Bridge,stands a low mound,all that remains of an{11th century motte & {bailey castle.}Prestatyn's recent expansion is due to its popularity as a seaside resort. Its population has risen from{700}in{1900}to{17,000}in 1985.}
